properties.label: Gene biotype
properties.description: Gene or transcript classification annotated in Ensembl

properties.label: Chromosome
properties.description: Chromosome where a gene is located

properties.label: # of exons
properties.description: Number of exons for each transcript of each gene

properties.label: # of paralogs
properties.description: Number of duplicated genes (paralogs) in each human gene calculated based on HomoloGene

properties.label: Evolutionary divergence
properties.description: Most distant organisms from human that have orthologous genes in HomoloGene

properties.label: High-level expression
properties.description: Tissues in which a gene was tissue-specific highly expressed only in one of 34 tissues of RefEx

properties.label: Low-level expression
properties.description: Tissues in which a gene was tissue-specific lowly expressed only in one of 34 tissues of RefEx

properties.label: Expressed in tissues
properties.description: Tissues in which a gene is tissue-specific highly expressed in 48 tissues of GTEx

properties.label: Not expressed in tissues
properties.description: Tissues in which expression of a gene is not detected in 48 tissues of GTEx

properties.label: Transcription factors
properties.description: Transcription factors with predicted target genes in ChIP-Atlas

properties.label: Protein domains
properties.description: Protein domains from UniProt

properties.label: Cellular component
properties.description: Functional annotations (GO terms) derived from the Cellular component category of GeneOntology, which Uniprot has assigned to each human protein with evidence information

properties.label: Biological process
properties.description: Functional annotations (GO terms) derived from the Biological process category of GeneOntology, which Uniprot has assigned to each human protein with evidence information

properties.label: Molecular function
properties.description: Functional annotations (GO terms) derived from the Molecular function category of GeneOntology, which Uniprot has assigned to each human protein with evidence information

properties.label: Ligands
properties.description: Classification by non-protein molecules which bind/react with proteins in Function section from UniProt

properties.label: Molecular mass
properties.description: Molecular weight of the protein including information from multiple isoforms in Sequences section from UniProt

properties.label: PTMs
properties.description: Classification by types of post-translational modifications, including S-S bonds (disulfide bonds) in Amino acid modifications section from UniProt

properties.label: # of transmembrane domains
properties.description: Number of transmembrane domains. A group of molecules forming a family, such as channels, may have the same number of domains in Topology section from UniProt

properties.label: # of phosphorylation sites
properties.description: Number of phosphorylation at Ser/Thr/Tyr, which may create an activation state for the protein and acts like a switch in Amino acid modifications section from UniProt

properties.label: # of glycosylation sites
properties.description: Number of glycosylation sites, including N-linked,O-linked and others in Amino acid modifications section from UniProt

properties.label: Disease-related proteins
properties.description: Disease-related proteins in Pathology & Biotech section from UniProt

properties.label: Tissues w/expression reported
properties.description: Classification based on the name of the tissue from which the clone was isolated in the reference describing the protein sequence in Tissue section from UniProt

properties.label: Evidence of existence
properties.description: Classification by the basis of protein expression, such as whether it has been identified as a protein or transcript in Expression section from neXtProt

properties.label: Structure data existence
properties.description: Uniprot entries having 3D structure data in PDB in Structure section from Uniprot

properties.label: # of alpha-helices
properties.description: Number of 'Helix' entities counted in each entry of PDB

properties.label: # of beta-sheets
properties.description: Number of 'Sheet' entities counted in each entry of PDB

properties.label: # of peptides in a PDB entry
properties.description: The number of peptides in a PDB entry

properties.label: Other related molecules
properties.description: Nonpeptide molecules related protein structures including water, metal ions, and low molecular weight compounds such as glycerol used to make crystals

properties.label: Analysis methods
properties.description: Classification by the method used to determine the three-dimensional structure in Experimental method section from PDB

properties.label: Crystallization temperature
properties.description: Temperature of the crystallization solution obtained in Crystallization Conditions section from PDB

properties.label: Crystallization pH
properties.description: pH value of the crystallization solution in Crystallization Conditions section from PDB

properties.label: Proteins in pathway
properties.description: Proteins participating as components classified by pathway (reaction) from Reactome

properties.label: Compounds in pathway
properties.description: Compounds participating as components classified by pathway (reaction) from Reactome

properties.label: # of interacting proteins
properties.description: Classification of uniprot proteins by the number of target proteins they interact with in Interaction section from UniProt

properties.label: ChEMBL assay existence
properties.description: Uniprot entries classified according to the presence or absence of a method to detect direct protein-compound interactions (ChEMBL assay)

properties.label: Substance type
properties.description: Classification based on the type of drug, such as compound or nucleic acid drugs from ChEMBL

properties.label: Chemical role
properties.description: Chemical roles in ChEBI

properties.label: Application type
properties.description: Application types in ChEBI

properties.label: Action type
properties.description: Classification based on the mechanism of action, such as an inhibitor or an antagonist from ChEMBL

properties.label: Biological role
properties.description: Biological roles in ChEBI

properties.label: Drug indication
properties.description: Classification of diseases for which drugs are indicated, based on hierarchical data using MeSH, a life science thesaurus from ChEMBL

properties.label: Drug development phase
properties.description: Classification based on the drug's development phase (research stage, phase I-III, and post-launch) from ChEMBL

properties.label: PubChem ATC classification
properties.description: Classification of a medicine (in PubChem) according to its medicinal properties (WHO ATC Code)

properties.label: ChEMBL ATC classification
properties.description: Classification of a medicine (in ChEMBL) according to its medicinal properties (WHO ATC Code)

properties.label: Diseases in Mondo
properties.description: Subcategories in the Disease or disorder category in the Mondo Disease Ontology (Mondo)

properties.label: Diseases in MeSH
properties.description: Subcategories in the Disease category in Medical Subject Headings (MeSH)

properties.label: Diseases in NANDO
properties.description: Japanese rare and intractable disease categories in the Nanbyo Disease Ontology (NANDO)

properties.label: Cross referenced disease DBs in Mondo
properties.description: Number of entries linked to Mondo in each of approx. 70 disease related databases from database cross reference in Mondo

properties.label: Phenotypic abnormality
properties.description: Classification the subcategories of the Phenotypic abnormality categories of the Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO)

properties.label: Consequence
properties.description: Classification of variants based on the consequence from TogoVar, such as amino acid substitution or frameshift. Predicted by the Variant Effect Predictor (VEP)

properties.label: Clinical significance
properties.description: Classification of variants according to their clinical significance, such as whether they are the cause of the disease or not. Obtained from ClinVar via TogoVar
